author: Chris Foy for the Daily Mail
title: Gloucester set to offer Ford route back into English rugby
text:
Gloucester are ready to offer Mike Ford a route back into English rugby as part of a new-look coaching team led by Phillipe Saint-Andre.
Sportsmail has learned that the West Country club will receive approval next week for the takeover led by French businessman, Mohed Altrad – who already owns Montpellier.
It is understood that World Rugby and European tournament organisers EPCR are satisfied that there is no conflict of interest, so the takeover can proceed, which will lead to a management overhaul.
Mike Ford is set to make his return as part of Phillipe Saint-Andre's staff at Gloucester
Ex-France coach Saint-Andre is poised to return to his former club as director of rugby, aided by another old Kingsholm favourite, Olivier Azam.
Ford is currently in charge at Toulon after being sacked by Bath at the end of last season but, with Fabien Galthie expected to take over at Stade Felix Mayol next season, he may re-surface at Gloucester.
Meanwhile, Sale have conceded defeat in their quest to sign George Ford, with director of rugby, Steve Diamond, suggesting that Leicester have ‘broken the bank’ to lure the England fly-half back from Bath.
Ford left his position as director of rugby at Bath in May 2016 after a disappointing season
